DOC.brief_summary: Evaluation of a new ventilatory mode Neurally Adjusted Ventilatory Assist "NAVA" in patients who recover spontaneous breathing after acute lung injury.
DOC.brief_title: NAV-ALI: Neurally Adjusted Ventilatory Assist in Patients Recovering Spontaneous Breathing After Acute Lung Injury
DOC.detailed_description: Physiological evaluation of two modes of mechanical ventilation: Neurally Adjusted Ventilatory Assist (NAVA) vs Pressure Support Ventilation, at different levels of ventilator assistance. Evaluation in term of physiological parameters: Tidal volume, Respiratory rate, Inspiratory effort, PaCO2, evaluation of subject-ventilator synchrony. Evaluation of physiological response to varying levels of ventilator assistance.
DOC.criteria: Age > 18 years Hospitalized in intensive care unit Acute Lung Injury Intubated or tracheotomized and mechanically ventilated Hemodynamic instability Absence of consent
